citation.article-title: Cloacibacillus evryensis gen. nov., sp. nov., a novel asaccharolytic, mesophilic, amino-acid-degrading bacterium within the phylum 'Synergistetes', isolated from an anaerobic sludge digester.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Cloacibacillus (Clo.a′ci.ba.cil.lus. L. n. cloaca a sewer canal; L. masc. n. bacillus a small staff; N.L. masc. n. Cloacibacillus a small staff from a sewer canal).
Cells are strictly anaerobic rods, non-motile, with no flagella.
Metabolism is fermentative, does not reduce any of the electron acceptors and does not perform the Stickland reaction.
The major fatty acids are iso-C15 : 0, iso-C15 : 0 3-OH and C17 : 1ω6c.
Members of this genus can be differentiated from other genera in the phylum ‘Synergistetes’ by 16S rRNA gene sequencing, CFA profiles, DNA G+C content and metabolic end products.
The genus is affiliated to the family ‘Synergistaceae’ in the phylum ‘Synergistetes’.
The type species is Cloacibacillus evryensis.
